compose verb
(BECOME CALM)
compose yourself
to make yourself calm again after being angry or upset: She finally stopped crying and composed herself. I was overcome emotionally and it took me some time to compose myself. Although the players composed themselves, there was no disguising their disappointment at the loss. After composing himself, Watson spoke to the crowd. Take a moment to compose yourself, then answer the questions truthfully. compose your features/thoughts
to try to make yourself look or feel calm after being angry or upset: I tried to compose my features into a smile.
